MCP_PROMPT_PROCESS_THOUGHT_APPEND=

# Workspace Operating Rules (MCP-first correctness)
- Always start by checking: (1) shrimp tasks (listTasks/queryTask) for duplicates, (2) neo4j memory for similar solutions/constraints, (3) repo evidence (read relevant files). If any is unavailable, mark UNCERTAIN and give the shortest verification path.
- Use MCP tools deliberately: duckduckgo for niche/up-to-date facts; github-mcp-custom for repo search/PR context; playwright for E2E; grafana for metrics/logs; neo4j-memory-server for lessons learned/how-to.
- Never claim something exists/works/is configured without citing exact file paths and (when critical) small snippets.
- Destructive ops (migrations/deletes/mass refactors/force push/infra/major deps): show rollback + exact commands, then stop for explicit user confirmation.
- Output: concise, decision-oriented; include 1 key risk/failure mode and 1 invalidating assumption when relevant.

MCP_PROMPT_INIT_PROJECT_RULES_APPEND=

# Project Rules (agent-usable)
Create rules optimized for agents (short, testable, repo-grounded). Prefer: coding standards, repo conventions, commands to verify, definition-of-done, and where-to-find-what. Avoid long prose; include paths and canonical docs locations.
Also propose 3–7 candidate "memories" (how-to/lessons/where-to-find) and ask the user to approve saving to neo4j memory.

MCP_PROMPT_PLAN_TASK_APPEND=

# Planning Requirements
Before planning: (1) listTasks/queryTask to avoid duplicates; (2) check neo4j memory for prior patterns/constraints; (3) read repo entrypoints relevant to the task.
Plan must include: scope + non-goals; files to touch; step-by-step checkpoints; acceptance criteria; explicit verification commands; risks + rollback; and dependencies. Produce tasks small enough to execute and verify deterministically.
If research is needed, call it out explicitly and use duckduckgo MCP; do not guess.

MCP_PROMPT_ANALYZE_TASK_APPEND=

# Analysis Requirements
Provide 2–3 viable approaches with trade-offs (correctness, maintainability, security, complexity). Identify unknowns and propose the fastest validation (tiny repro, grep, minimal test, targeted doc/source).
Security-by-design: note authn/authz, input validation, secrets handling, and logging.
When facts may be time-sensitive or niche, verify via duckduckgo MCP and cite what changed.

MCP_PROMPT_SPLIT_TASKS_APPEND=

# Task Decomposition Rules
Split into atomic tasks with: objective, exact outputs (files/changes), preconditions, and verification commands. Keep each task executable end-to-end without hidden dependencies.
Ensure ordering/dep graph is explicit. Prefer fewer, clearer tasks over many micro-tasks.

MCP_PROMPT_EXECUTE_TASK_APPEND=

# Execution Rules
Execute exactly one task at a time unless the user explicitly requests continuous execution.
Before edits: read relevant files; do not invent APIs. During execution: implement + verify locally (or provide exact commands) + update canonical docs + remove temp artifacts.
If UI/E2E relevant, use playwright. If runtime/ops signals matter, use grafana to validate metrics/logs.
If blocked (secrets/access/CI), stop at the smallest blocker and propose the fastest unblock path.

MCP_PROMPT_VERIFY_TASK_APPEND=

# Verification Bar
Verification must be explicit: commands (lint/typecheck/tests/build) and expected signals. If you cannot run them, provide exact commands and what "good" looks like.
If deployment is required to validate, state the minimum pipeline evidence required and the environment-dependent checks.

MCP_PROMPT_REFLECT_TASK_APPEND=

# Reflection + Knowledge Capture
Assess: what worked, what failed, and one improvement to prevent regressions.
Propose 3–7 memory candidates (how-to, lessons learned, where-to-find) and ask the user whether to save them to neo4j memory. Only save if user approves.

MCP_PROMPT_LIST_TASKS_APPEND=

When listing tasks, present IDs, titles, status, next action, and the recommended task to execute next (with 1-sentence rationale).

MCP_PROMPT_QUERY_TASK_APPEND=

When querying tasks, prefer exact matches first; show task IDs and why they match the query.

MCP_PROMPT_GET_TASK_DETAIL_APPEND=

When showing a task, include: goal, current status, dependencies, latest changes, and the next verification step.
